title: A replacement of my old ATM after Vista upgrade?
content:
Hi guys,

How should I do now that I’ve discovered that my old ATM  
doesn’t work on Vista?

Is there any way so that I can continue to use PFB/PFM fonts on  
my new computer?

Thanks :)

 [‹ Italic accent placement.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016080302/http:/typophile.com/node/37861 "Go to previous forum topic") [Glyph ID and the cmap table ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016080302/http:/typophile.com/node/37742 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sleidia

comments.content: Well, there are a lot of font managers, but a lot of them are pretty crap. I’ve tried [FontExpert](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016080302/http:/www.proximasoftware.com/fontexpert/), which is not super, but it is not too bad either. I don’t run Vista, but the website says [FontExpert 2007](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016080302/http:/www.proximasoftware.com/fontexpert/) is also for Vista.

Thanks :)

Just in case, are there free alternatives too?

I think there probably are freeware alternatives.  
But you should search for it on google, I would have to as well. ;)
I use Extensis Suitcase under Vista. The latest version is OK.

Note that you don’t actually require ATM to use Type 1 fonts (PFB/PFM) under Vista. Of course, you may still want to use a font management tool of some sort. Currently, Windows font management is unexciting IMO.

Regards,

T

Thanks a lot Thomas!  
Indeed, I didn’t know that Vista alone could handle PFB/PBM fonts!  
Your contribution was really appreciated.  
Thanks again :)
